message_1: Consider a projective variety $X$ of dimension $3$ over complex numbers with an irreducible decomposition $X = X_1 \cup X_2$. Let $\mathcal{IC}_X$ be the intersection cohomology complex of $X$ and let $\mathcal{IC}_{X_1}$ and $\mathcal{IC}_{X_2}$ be the intersection cohomology complexes of $X_1$ and $X_2$ respectively. If we know that $H^6(X, \mathcal{IC}_X) \cong \mathbb{C}^{13}$, $H^4(X_1, \mathcal{IC}_{X_1}) \cong \mathbb{C}^{5}$, $H^5(X_2, \mathcal{IC}_{X_2}) \cong \mathbb{C}^{3}$ and $H^7(X_2, \mathcal{IC}_{X_2}) \cong \mathbb{C}^{2}$, what is the dimension of $H^8(X, \mathcal{IC}_X)$?
message_2:
To compute the dimension of $H^8(X, \mathcal{IC}_X)$, we will use the Mayer-Vietoris sequence for intersection cohomology. Let $X_{12} = X_1 \cap X_2$. Then we have the following long exact sequence:

$$\cdots \to H^k(X, \mathcal{IC}_X) \to H^k(X_1, \mathcal{IC}_{X_1}) \oplus H^k(X_2, \mathcal{IC}_{X_2}) \to H^k(X_{12}, \mathcal{IC}_{X_{12}}) \to H^{k+1}(X, \mathcal{IC}_X) \to \cdots$$

We are interested in the dimension of $H^8(X, \mathcal{IC}_X)$. We have the following part of the Mayer-Vietoris sequence:

$$H^6(X, \mathcal{IC}_X) \to H^6(X_1, \mathcal{IC}_{X_1}) \oplus H^6(X_2, \mathcal{IC}_{X_2}) \to H^6(X_{12}, \mathcal{IC}_{X_{12}}) \to H^7(X, \mathcal{IC}_X) \to H^7(X_1, \mathcal{IC}_{X_1}) \oplus H^7(X_2, \mathcal{IC}_{X_2}) \to H^7(X_{12}, \mathcal{IC}_{X_{12}}) \to H^8(X, \mathcal{IC}_X) \to 0$$

Since $X$ has dimension $3$, we know that $H^k(X, \mathcal{IC}_X) = 0$ for $k > 6$. Therefore, we have:

$$0 \to H^8(X, \mathcal{IC}_X) \to 0$$

This implies that $H^8(X, \mathcal{IC}_X) \cong 0$, and thus the dimension of $H^8(X, \mathcal{IC}_X)$ is $\boxed{0}$.
